image.altText: A collapsed wind turbine

props.synopsis: Authorities are working to investigate the collapse of a wind turbine at the Berrybank Wind Farm, west of Geelong.

title.children: Wind turbine falls in Victorian storms prompting call for safety audit

image.altText: A street post with one way pointing to 'Historic Way' and the other way pointing to 'Offensive Place'

props.synopsis: Places and their names can hold different meanings for different people, but what happens when those in a community are uncomfortable with a historical figure or the association a place is named after?

title.children: Hundreds of places in Australia contain this 'racist slur' that experts want changed

image.altText: A sign reading supreme court

props.synopsis: Prosecutors have dropped a case against Victorian woman Ilknur Caliskan who claimed to be asleep when she stabbed her husband to death during a camping trip in 2023.

title.children: Case dropped against Victorian woman who killed husband in her sleep

image.altText: Graffiti on the side of a high-rise building

props.synopsis: Two men accused of causing hundreds of thousands of dollars in graffiti damage across Melbourne are contesting the charges in court.

title.children: FBI called in to help in case against alleged Pam the Bird creator

image.altText: Troy Selwood of the Lions runs with the ball

props.synopsis: Former Brisbane Lions player Troy Selwood, brother of Geelong premiership captain Joel, has died aged 40.Â

title.children: Family 'heartbroken' by sudden death of former AFL player Troy Selwood

image.altText: Dale Tapping at a press conference, standing and looking at reporters

props.synopsis: Dale Tapping was diagnosed with the aggressive form of blood cancer in January 2023 and died on Tuesday at the age of 59, the club said.

title.children: AFL world mourns after death of Bombers and Lions assistant coach

image.altText: Lawrence has police officers on both sides. He has his head down as he is moved into a police van from court room.

props.synopsis: A 45-year-old Victorian man who allegedly ploughed through a regional shopping centre in the middle of the after-school rush has been charged with a slew of driving offences.

title.children: Man accused of driving car through shopping centre faces court

image.altText: A man in plain clothes hands boxes of food to man in yellow CFA overalls

props.synopsis: In Cavendish, there are only two food joints. Now at the centre of Grampians fires, the often sleepy Bridge Cafe is feeding hundreds of hot, exhausted firies.

title.children: Cafe couple work day and night to feed town full of exhausted firefighters

image.altText: A large lightning bolt hits the ground at night with city lights and a bridge illuminated.

props.synopsis: Dry lightning strikes have been blamed for causing a number of bushfires across Victoria. But what's the difference between dry and wet lightning?Â

title.children: What is dry lightning and how does it start bushfires?

image.altText: A blazing orange sun sits above golden clouds.

props.synopsis: Authorities continue to battle several bushfires in the state's west, with temperatures finally starting to drop after another day of extreme heat.

title.children: Multi-day heatwave coming to an end, except in the stateâs north

image.altText: Aerial vision shows a collapsed house.

props.synopsis: The state government announces an independent inquiry into the cause of a landslide south east of Melbourne, as residents of more than a dozen homes remain unable to return to their Mornington Peninsula properties.

title.children: Inquiry announced into McCrae landslide as locals wait to return home

image.altText: an illustration of an unidentified young girl wearing a white dress facing away

props.synopsis: Two former homeschoolers who say they were denied a proper education are calling for mandatory home visits. But advocates say tighter regulations aren't the answer.

title.children: Why Samantha feels homeschooling robbed her of a 'proper education'

image.altText: A large rainbow flag is waved in the air.

props.synopsis: The government will need to rely on the crossbench to pass proposed legislation, with the opposition concerned those claiming a political stance will be able to circumvent the laws.

title.children: Plans to expand Victoria's hate speech laws face opposition road block

image.altText: A woman standing outside her home

props.synopsis: Kaye Powell is preparing to cut her 99-year-old Reservoir home in half, put it on the back of a truck and transport it almost 100 kilometres away to Malmsbury.

title.children: The 100km journey to give a century-old Victorian home a new life

image.altText: A door smashed through, with shops in the background.

props.synopsis: Police say a person in a red Ford Falcon ute drove through the front glass doors of Gippsland Centre in Sale before exiting on the other side and fleeing the scene.

title.children: People duck for cover as man drives ute through Sale shopping centre

image.altText: A photo of missing woman Samantha Murphy in a formal floral dress.

props.synopsis: Samantha Murphy vanished on her morning run one year ago, and her home town of Ballarat is forever changed.

title.children: Samantha Murphy's hometown has changed since she disappeared a year ago

image.altText: A parade participant on stilts wears a white jumpsuit with butterflies, white feathered wings and rainbow leg coverings.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan has vowed Victoria "will fight for our LGBTIQA+ community" as tens of thousands gather for the 30th anniversary Midsumma parade.

title.children: Victorian premier takes a swipe at Donald Trump ahead of Pride March

image.altText: A young girl in pigtails and denim overalls sits at a piano with sheet music. Her hands are on the keys as she reads the music.

props.synopsis: Learning music can increase children's capacity for persistence and resilience. Here's how to set them up for success when they start their musical journey.

title.children: How to set children up for success when they start learning music

image.altText: A crowd of people, one carrying a campaign sign for Angelica Di Camillo, cross a pedestrian crossing towards a market.

props.synopsis: Stabbings and firebombings in the popular Chapel Street strip dominate news headlines, but a more localised crime wave could sway voters in next week's Prahran by-election.

title.children: Crime, cost of living up as Prahran head into a by-election

image.altText: An aerial view of the an arterial road and the suburban homes at Werribee on Melbourne's western fringe.

props.synopsis: The seat of Werribee is shaping up to be an interesting contest as party leaders eye the outer suburbs for key federal electoral success.Â

title.children: Why the previously safe seat of Werribee is one to watch this weekend

image.altText: A smiling man, child and woman in a pool.

props.synopsis: A 10-week program helps adult migrants learn to swim and enjoy the water on the outskirts of Melbourne, after a spate of drownings on the nearby Bass Coast.Â

title.children: Migrant community learning to swim after tragic year of drownings

image.altText: Newsreader Season 3

props.synopsis: The ABC's award-winning drama The Newsreader is back for a third season â so how much does it get right about late-80s news and culture, and where are the white lies?

title.children: The real-world facts behind the fiction in The Newsreader's season 3

image.altText: A lone firefighter stands near his firetruck in a burnt out clearing - among fire damaged trees, a building, and car.

props.synopsis: Grassfires sparked by lightning destroyed at least two homes in Victoria's north west overnight, with fears of more property losses to come as heatwave conditions continue across the state until Tuesday.

title.children: Lightning sparks new fires, houses destroyed as Victoria's heatwave continues

image.altText: A police officer stands on the footpath of a road that is blocked by a police car, police tape and orange traffic cones.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the death of a woman in Ascot Vale and a subsequent fatal freeway incident at Little River.Â

title.children: Man's death linked to discovery of woman's body in Melbourne

image.altText: A suburban home with a palm tree in the garden

props.synopsis: A 42-year-old man has been charged following the suspicious death of a man in his 90s in the town of Morwell, in Victoria's Latrobe Valley.

title.children: Police charge man over suspicious death of Victorian man in his 90s

image.altText: A drone shot of three-storey brick units on a sunny bright day.

props.synopsis: The ongoing pressure of high interest rates and the cost of living has pushed down house prices in some capital cities, opening up the market for first home buyers.

title.children: 'Buyers' market' opens up in some areas as house prices flatten

image.altText: George Pell

props.synopsis: Two men were compensated after the National Redress Scheme accepted they were abused as boys by the late Cardinal George Pell in Ballarat in the 1970s.

title.children: George Pell raped, groped two boys in Ballarat, compensation scheme decides

image.altText: Sam Abdulrahim shirtless with boxing tape around his hands leaning on a ledge.

props.synopsis: Another deadly shooting in 2016 sparked a feud between two underworld figures that would span a decade. Sources believe it may be what led to the killing of Sam "The Punisher" Abdulrahim.

title.children: The feud that ended with the execution of Melbourne's most-hunted man

image.altText: A police car outside a house.

props.synopsis: A third man has been charged with murder following a fatal double shooting on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula last December.

title.children: Third man charged over fatal double shooting on Mornington Peninsula

image.altText: A man in a white t-shirt stands with his arm around another man in a checkered shirt, next to a woman in a pink top.

props.synopsis: Luke Wentworth's death is one of four that have rocked Australia's water ski community recently, triggering a self-imposed ban amid investigations into the sport's safety.

title.children: Waterski's 'social licence' hangs in the balance 12 months after tragedy

image.altText: Richard Barron pictured in an office, smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The principal of Langwarrin Park Primary School, Richard Barren, is charged with possessing child abuse material, the Victorian Education Department has confirmed.

title.children: Melbourne principal charged with child abuse material possession

image.altText: An aircrew sitting underneath a twin-engined bomber as another bomber takes off in the background.

props.synopsis: Bert O'Leary, who just celebrated his 100th birthday, shares the terror and drudgery of life as airman aboard a Vickers Wellington in the Battle of the Atlantic.

title.children: 100yo RAAF airman recalls 'needle in a haystack' hunt for WWII U-boats

image.altText: A graffiti bird on a silo

props.synopsis: For more than a year, "Pam the Bird" soared over Melbourne, appearing on city landmarks, skyscrapers and road signs. But the cartoon bird's alleged creator could be grounded.

title.children: 'Notorious vandal': Police say accused was unemployed, sometimes violent

image.altText: A young white boy with fair hair playing with his parents

props.synopsis: Eddy's mum says he's caught between two systems â and there's concern more cases like his will soon crop up across Australia, write Evan Young and Nas Campanella.Â

title.children: This boy personifies the NDIS issue expected to dominate 2025

image.altText: Saffron the camel is treated to a massage by equine soft tissue therapist Christian Langeder.

props.synopsis: How do you treat arthritis in an ageing Arabian camel? Zookeepers at Werribee Open Range Zoo have found a soothing solution.

title.children: Almost over the hump: Zookeepers amazed at camel's love of massages
